result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas James Wagner-Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

  All appearances by phone.  950/Marsy's Law complied with.  Authorization to Appear on file. Motion was previously filed ref evidence not turned over. State advises evidence will be turned over but will let ADA Gabler work on this issue. Court will reserve ruling until after ADA Gabler responds  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Clerk found amount paid for bond was $150 on 1/21/22 not $650.  Atty Kaehne and ADA Stuart were on the conference line for branch 3 today and Atty Kaehne brought up the issue.  Court had clerk change the cash bond to the $150 that was paid as that is what the court commissioner intended the bond to be-whatever he had posted the night of the incident.
Motion hearing on April 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Motion for bond modification (defense) SOB link is not necessary.  It is a financial burden for deft/family. Court grants defense bond motion.
